age.medical_interpretation: Age distribution appears balanced, suggesting a representative sample across age groups.

chol.medical_interpretation: Cholesterol distribution is relatively symmetric, suggesting a well-distributed range of cholesterol levels.

thalach.medical_interpretation: Maximum heart rate distribution shows expected pattern for a diverse cardiac patient population.

oldpeak.medical_interpretation: ST depression distribution is right-skewed, with most patients showing smaller depressions and fewer patients with severe ST depression.

trestbps.medical_interpretation: Distribution of trestbps provides insights into the spread and central tendency of this parameter in the patient population.

target_binary.medical_interpretation: Significant age differences between patients with and without heart disease suggest age is an important risk factor.

sex.medical_interpretation: Analysis of age across different sex groups provides insights into population heterogeneity.

age_group.medical_interpretation: Age-related variations in age suggest the importance of age-stratified approaches to cardiac risk assessment.

target_binary.medical_interpretation: Analysis of chol across different target_binary groups provides insights into population heterogeneity.

sex.medical_interpretation: Gender-based differences in chol may indicate the need for gender-specific risk assessment or treatment approaches.

age_group.medical_interpretation: Analysis of chol across different age_group groups provides insights into population heterogeneity.

target_binary.medical_interpretation: Significant differences in maximum heart rate between patients with and without heart disease may indicate functional cardiac capacity disparities.

sex.medical_interpretation: Gender-based differences in thalach may indicate the need for gender-specific risk assessment or treatment approaches.

age_group.medical_interpretation: Age-related variations in thalach suggest the importance of age-stratified approaches to cardiac risk assessment.

target_binary.medical_interpretation: Significant differences in ST depression between groups highlight its value as a diagnostic indicator.

sex.medical_interpretation: Gender-based differences in oldpeak may indicate the need for gender-specific risk assessment or treatment approaches.

age_group.medical_interpretation: Age-related variations in oldpeak suggest the importance of age-stratified approaches to cardiac risk assessment.

target_binary.medical_interpretation: Significant differences in trestbps between patients with and without heart disease suggest its potential diagnostic or prognostic value.

sex.medical_interpretation: Analysis of trestbps across different sex groups provides insights into population heterogeneity.

age_group.medical_interpretation: Age-related variations in trestbps suggest the importance of age-stratified approaches to cardiac risk assessment.

key_findings: age varies significantly across Disease Status groups (Mann-Whitney U test, p=0.0000)
age varies significantly across Age Group groups (Kruskal-Wallis H-test, p=0.0000)
chol varies significantly across Gender groups (Mann-Whitney U test, p=0.0005)
thalach varies significantly across Disease Status groups (Mann-Whitney U test, p=0.0000)
thalach varies significantly across Gender groups (Mann-Whitney U test, p=0.0000)
thalach varies significantly across Age Group groups (Kruskal-Wallis H-test, p=0.0000)
oldpeak varies significantly across Disease Status groups (Mann-Whitney U test, p=0.0000)
oldpeak varies significantly across Gender groups (Mann-Whitney U test, p=0.0019)
oldpeak varies significantly across Age Group groups (Kruskal-Wallis H-test, p=0.0000)
trestbps varies significantly across Disease Status groups (Mann-Whitney U test, p=0.0017)
trestbps varies significantly across Age Group groups (Kruskal-Wallis H-test, p=0.0000)
clinical_interpretations: Age distribution appears balanced, suggesting a representative sample across age groups.
Cholesterol distribution is relatively symmetric, suggesting a well-distributed range of cholesterol levels.
Maximum heart rate distribution shows expected pattern for a diverse cardiac patient population.
ST depression distribution is right-skewed, with most patients showing smaller depressions and fewer patients with severe ST depression.
Distribution of trestbps provides insights into the spread and central tendency of this parameter in the patient population.
Significant age differences between patients with and without heart disease suggest age is an important risk factor.
Age-related variations in age suggest the importance of age-stratified approaches to cardiac risk assessment.
Gender-based differences in chol may indicate the need for gender-specific risk assessment or treatment approaches.
Significant differences in maximum heart rate between patients with and without heart disease may indicate functional cardiac capacity disparities.
Gender-based differences in thalach may indicate the need for gender-specific risk assessment or treatment approaches.
Age-related variations in thalach suggest the importance of age-stratified approaches to cardiac risk assessment.
Significant differences in ST depression between groups highlight its value as a diagnostic indicator.
Gender-based differences in oldpeak may indicate the need for gender-specific risk assessment or treatment approaches.
Age-related variations in oldpeak suggest the importance of age-stratified approaches to cardiac risk assessment.
Significant differences in trestbps between patients with and without heart disease suggest its potential diagnostic or prognostic value.
Age-related variations in trestbps suggest the importance of age-stratified approaches to cardiac risk assessment.
